meanings.sent1: I need to finalise my homework before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: She always finalises her chores before going out to play.
meanings.sent3: The race to finalise the puzzle was on between the siblings.
meanings.sent4: The chef's signature dish was the perfect way to finalise the meal.
meanings.sent5: The last piece of the puzzle helped finalise the picture.

meanings.definition: To make a decision or agreement official.
meanings.sent1: Let's finalise our plans for the weekend getaway.
meanings.sent2: The lawyers will finalise the contract tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The friends had to finalise who would bring the snacks for the movie night.
meanings.sent4: The handshake finalised their partnership in the business venture.
meanings.sent5: The official stamp was needed to finalise the document.

meanings.definition: To put an end to something.
meanings.sent1: It's time to finalise this argument and move on.
meanings.sent2: The meeting will finalise the discussion on the project's future.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his final trick to finalise the show.
meanings.sent4: The sunset finalised the day with its beautiful colors.
meanings.sent5: The judge's verdict will finalise the court case.
